column4: anyone willing to help me with ndiswrapper? I get an error when trying to compile from source. "make: *** /lib/modules/2.6.12-10-386/build: No such file or directory.  Stop."
if you *must* build it, install linux-headers($uname -r) as well as build-essential and gcc-3.4
thx,
try linux-header-$(uname -r)
I got the packages you recommended installed and all it did was change the error message. Got time to help me a bit?
what news?  I have been away for a while
I got the packages you recommended and it just changed the error message
what are you trying to build? And what is the current message?
the latest ndiswrapper    so I can support my dwl-g122
I haven't needed ndiswrapper, so haven't tried building it.  You may need to set CC=/usr/bin/gcc-3.4 before runnig the build/configure (to tell the make subsystem to use that rather than /usr/bin/gcc
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/7056
you ned to escape the space (eg 'My\ Downloads' )
??  you mean rename the folder without the space? or some other command?
I wouild try  'mkdir ~/src; mv ~/My Downloads/RT25USB-SRC-V2.0.6.0 ~/src/RT25USB-SRC-V2.0.6.0 then re-run the build from there.  Directory names with spaces in them are hard to work with in Makefiles
I renamed the folder and it seems to be working
that sounds promising.
It compiled!  I used insmod to load the module and it loaded ok
thats great.
hmm, but no connection
I can't help there - the kernel module I built was the VMware drivers.
any progress?
I got it to start compiling but then the error just changed  I fixed that and then another error farther along
I'm in relax mode now. I'll get back to it tomorrow
